doc.field:
This dataset is a 30 meter digital elevation model of the seven county Twin Cities metropolitan area. The data represent an elevation surface of the TCMA in a regular grid where each grid cell is a 30 meter by 30 meter square with a single elevation value for each cell given in feet above mean sea level.
Note: When processing this dataset keep in mind that the vertical units for this dataset are feet while the horizontal units are meters.

<?xml version="1.0"?><metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Metropolitan Council</origin> <pubdate>Unpublished material</pubdate> <title>30 Meter Digital Elevation Model</title> <mgmg1cid /> <pubinfo> <publish>Metropolitan Council</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>ftp://gisftp.metc.state.mn.us/DEM30Meter.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>This dataset is a 30 meter digital elevation model of the seven county Twin Cities metropolitan area. The data represent an elevation surface of the TCMA in a regular grid where each grid cell is a 30 meter by 30 meter square with a single elevation value for each cell given in feet above mean sea level.
Note: When processing this dataset keep in mind that the vertical units for this dataset are feet while the horizontal units are meters.</abstract> <purpose>This digital elevation model reflects surface elevation in the Twin Cities metropolitan area and supports various regional and sub-regional scale topographic analysis (e.g. slope, aspect, etc.).</purpose> <supplinf>Includes 88 USGS 7.5 minute quadrangles intersecting the minor watersheds intersecting the Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>1980</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>Base information is as current as the publication of its source USGS quadrangle maps which vary in publication date from 1979 to 1990 and the national wetlands inventory (lake areas only) which was also published in the early 1980s.</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-96.912</westbc> <eastbc>-92.521</eastbc> <northbc>47.526</northbc> <southbc>44.244</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>elevation, topography, DEM, digital elevation model</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>None</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Steve Kloiber</cntper> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council Environmental Services</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>Senior Water Resource Planner</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1056</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1130</cntfax> <cntemail>steve.kloiber@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen>http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/bg/DEM30Meter.gif</browsen> <browsed>Sample map showing the DEM30Meter layer.</browsed> </browse> <native>ArcInfo Version 8x Grid</native> <crossref> <citeinfo> <title>10-foot elevation contours, Topographic Depressions (Sinks), DNR Lakes (Extracted from NWI)</title> </citeinfo> </crossref> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>This dataset is a grid file with elevation as the only attribute. The accuracy of this attribute is discussed under the topic of vertical position accuracy in this metadata file.</attraccr> </attracc> <logic>The data are topologically correct and verified</logic> <complete>The dataset is complete for the 89 USGS 7.5 minute quadrangles.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>Positional accuracy for areas derived from 7.5 minute quads cannot be assumed to exceed National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:24,000 scale maps (+/- 40 feet).</horizpar> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr>Vertical accuracy for areas derived from 7.5 minute quads cannot be assumed to exceed National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:24,000 scale maps with 10-foot elevation contours (+/- 5 feet).</vertaccr> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srcscale>24000</srcscale> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>The software used to derive the dataset was ANUDEM (http://cres.anu.edu.au/outputs/software.html). Input data included elevation contours derived from USGS 10-foot DLG contours, topographic depression points, and lake polygons extracted from the National Wetlands Inventory by the Minnesota DNR.
Tile boundaries for the lake data were dissolved prior to processing. Lake surface elevations were calculated as zonal minimums of surface elevations for each lake. The resulting output is in a floating point grid, with units of feet.
The interpolation parameters used in ANUDEM for this process were as follows:
Drainage Enforcement On Elevation Data Consists Mainly of Contours Non-Negative RMS Factor = 1.0 Vertical SE = 0.0 Roughness Penalty = 0.0 (Recommended for Contour Data) Elevation Tolerance 1 = 5.0 feet Elevation Tolerance 2 = 100.0 feet Maximum Number of Iterations = 40 Elevation Units = Feet Elevation Minimum = 660.0 feet Elevation Maximum = 1230.0 feet Elevation Centered on Grid Cell Center Horizontal Position Units = Meters Grid Spacing = 30.0 X Limit (Minimum) = 410730.0 X Limit (Maximum) = 529740.0 Y Limit (Minimum) = 4913520.0 Y Limit (Maximum) = 5038710.0 Number of Columns in Output Grid = 3967 Number of Rows in Output Grid = 4173 Grid Margin = 20 cells Number of Input Files = 5 Input File 1 = input_pt.gen (ArcInfo Point Data) Input File 2 = hyps_upl.gen (ArcInfo Contour Data) Input File 3 = dem_lake.gen (ArcInfo Lake Boundary Data) Input File 4 = dem_sink.gen (ArcInfo Sink Point Data) Input File 5 = union1.gen (ArcInfo Polygon)
NOTE: Drainage enforcement was used, but stream data was not used. The data have not been hydrologically corrected. Using the drainage enforcement option has the effect of filling small spurious sinks that are created as an artifact of the interpolation process. Only sinks that exceed the Elevation Tolerance 1 value (5.0 feet) or sinks that are specifically identified in the topographic depression data file will be retained.</procdesc> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <indspref>None</indspref> <direct>Raster</direct> <mgmg3obj>Integer grid, 30 meter cell size</mgmg3obj> <mgmg3til>One layer for entire area.</mgmg3til> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres /> <longres /> <geogunit /></geograph> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn /> <mgmg4par /> <otherprj /> </mapproj> <gridsys> <gridsysn>UTM</gridsysn> <utm> <utmzone>15</utmzone> </utm> <spcs> <spcszone /> </spcs> <mgmg4coz /> <mgmg4adj /> </gridsys> <planci> <coordrep> <absres>30</absres> <ordres>30</ordres> </coordrep> <distbrep> <distres>30</distres> </distbrep> <plandu>Meters</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>NAD83</horizdn> <ellips>GRS80</ellips> </geodetic> </horizsys> <vertdef> <altsys> <altdatum>NAVD88</altdatum> <altunits>Feet</altunits> </altsys> <depthsys> <depthdn>Not applicable</depthdn> <depthdu /> </depthsys> </vertdef> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>Attributes retain the elevation of the grid cell as derived from the ANUDEM processing, described in Lineage.
No value attribute table was created.</eaover> <eadetcit>None</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Mark Kotz</cntper> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Database Administrator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101-1805</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1644</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1674</cntfax> <cntemail>mark.kotz@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>DEM30Meter</resdesc> <distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.</distliab> <stdorder> <digform> <digtinfo> <formname>zipped grid dataset</formname> <formvern>ArcInfo: 8x</formvern> <transize>38 MB for zip file.</transize> </digtinfo> </digform> <ordering>This dataset is distributed on the internet by clicking below after 'Online Linkage'. Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- Grid dataset - metdata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software. </ordering> </stdorder> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20020403</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Steve Kloiber</cntper> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council Environmental Services</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>Senior Water Resources Planner</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101-1805</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1056</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1130</cntfax> <cntemail>steve.kloiber@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>Minnesota Geographic Metadata Guidelines</metstdn> <metstdv>1.2</metstdv> <metextns> <onlink>http://www.gis.state.mn.us/stds/metadata.htm</onlink> </metextns> </metainfo> <Esri><ModDate>20040528</ModDate><ModTime>11183600</ModTime></Esri><mdDateSt Sync="TRUE">20040528</mdDateSt></metadata>
